info.title: Airweave
info.description:
## API Groups
This API spec only includes the following API groups:
- **Sources**: API endpoints for discovering available data source connectors and their configuration requirements
- **Collections**: API endpoints for managing collections - logical groups of data sources that provide unified search capabilities
- **Source Connections**: API endpoints for managing live connections to data sources. Source connections are the actual configured instances that Airweave uses to sync data from your apps and databases, transforming it into searchable, structured information within collections
- **Webhooks**: API endpoints for managing webhook subscriptions and messages. Subscribe to events like sync completions to receive real-time notifications at your webhook URL

get.description:
Retrieve all available data source connectors.

Returns the complete catalog of source types that Airweave can connect to,
including their authentication methods, configuration requirements, and
supported features. Use this endpoint to discover which integrations are
available for your organization.

Each source includes:
- **Authentication methods**: How to connect (OAuth, API key, etc.)
- **Configuration schemas**: What settings are required or optional
- **Supported auth providers**: Pre-configured OAuth providers available

available_sources.summary: List of all available data source connectors

value.name: GitHub
value.description: Connect to GitHub repositories for code, issues, pull requests, and documentation

fields.name: personal_access_token
fields.title: Personal Access Token
fields.description: GitHub Personal Access Token with repository read permissions

get.description:
Retrieve detailed information about a specific data source connector.

Returns the complete configuration for a source type, including:

- **Authentication fields**: Schema for credentials required to connect
- **Configuration fields**: Schema for optional settings and customization
- **Supported auth providers**: Pre-configured OAuth providers available for this source

Use this endpoint before creating a source connection to understand what
authentication and configuration values are required.

parameters.name: short_name

schema.description: Technical identifier of the source type (e.g., 'github', 'stripe', 'slack')
schema.title: Short Name

parameters.description: Technical identifier of the source type (e.g., 'github', 'stripe', 'slack')

github_source.summary: Source details with authentication and configuration schemas

value.name: GitHub
value.description: Connect to GitHub repositories for code, issues, pull requests, and documentation

fields.name: personal_access_token
fields.title: Personal Access Token
fields.description: GitHub Personal Access Token with repository read permissions

get.description:
Retrieve all collections belonging to your organization.

Collections are containers that group related data from one or more source
connections, enabling unified search across multiple data sources.

Results are sorted by creation date (newest first) and support pagination
and text search filtering.

parameters.name: skip

schema.description: Number of collections to skip for pagination
schema.title: Skip

parameters.description: Number of collections to skip for pagination

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Maximum number of collections to return (1-1000)
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: Maximum number of collections to return (1-1000)

parameters.name: search

schema.description: Search term to filter collections by name or readable_id
schema.title: Search

parameters.description: Search term to filter collections by name or readable_id

post.description:
Create a new collection in your organization.

Collections are containers for organizing and searching across data from multiple
sources. After creation, add source connections to begin syncing data.

The collection will be assigned a unique `readable_id` based on the name you provide,
which is used in URLs and API calls. You can optionally configure:

- **Sync schedule**: How frequently to automatically sync data from all sources
- **Custom readable_id**: Provide your own identifier (must be unique and URL-safe)

get.description:
Retrieve details of a specific collection by its readable ID.

Returns the complete collection configuration including sync settings, status,
and metadata. Use this to check the current state of a collection or to get
configuration details before making updates.

parameters.name: readable_id

schema.description: The unique readable identifier of the collection (e.g., 'finance-data-ab123')
schema.title: Readable Id

parameters.description: The unique readable identifier of the collection (e.g., 'finance-data-ab123')

patch.description:
Update an existing collection's properties.

You can modify:
- **Name**: The display name shown in the UI
- **Sync configuration**: Schedule settings for automatic data synchronization

Note that the `readable_id` cannot be changed after creation to maintain stable
API endpoints and preserve existing integrations.

parameters.name: readable_id

schema.description: The unique readable identifier of the collection to update
schema.title: Readable Id

parameters.description: The unique readable identifier of the collection to update

delete.description:
Permanently delete a collection and all associated data.

This operation:
- Removes all synced data from the vector database
- Deletes all source connections within the collection
- Cancels any scheduled sync jobs
- Cleans up all related resources

**Warning**: This action cannot be undone. All data will be permanently deleted.

parameters.name: readable_id

schema.description: The unique readable identifier of the collection to delete
schema.title: Readable Id

parameters.description: The unique readable identifier of the collection to delete

post.description:
Trigger data synchronization for all source connections in a collection.

Starts sync jobs for every source connection in the collection, pulling the latest
data from each connected source. Jobs run asynchronously in the background.

Returns a list of sync jobs that were created. Use the source connection endpoints
to monitor the progress and status of individual sync jobs.

parameters.name: readable_id

schema.description: The unique readable identifier of the collection to refresh
schema.title: Readable Id

parameters.description: The unique readable identifier of the collection to refresh

schema.title: Response Refresh All Source Connections Collections  Readable Id  Refresh All Post

get.description:
**DEPRECATED**: Use POST /collections/{readable_id}/search instead.

This legacy GET endpoint provides basic search functionality via query parameters.
Migrate to the POST endpoint for access to advanced features like:
- Structured filters
- Query expansion
- Reranking
- Streaming responses

parameters.name: readable_id

schema.description: The unique readable identifier of the collection to search
schema.title: Readable Id

parameters.description: The unique readable identifier of the collection to search

parameters.name: query

schema.description: The search query text to find relevant documents and data
schema.example: How do I reset my password?
schema.title: Query

parameters.description: The search query text to find relevant documents and data

parameters.name: response_type

schema.description: Format of the response: 'raw' returns search results, 'completion' returns AI-generated answers

parameters.description: Format of the response: 'raw' returns search results, 'completion' returns AI-generated answers

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Maximum number of results to return
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return

parameters.name: offset

schema.description: Number of results to skip for pagination
schema.title: Offset

parameters.description: Number of results to skip for pagination

parameters.name: recency_bias

schema.description: How much to weigh recency vs similarity (0=similarity only, 1=recency only)
schema.title: Recency Bias

parameters.description: How much to weigh recency vs similarity (0=similarity only, 1=recency only)

post.description:
Search your collection using semantic and hybrid search.

This is the primary search endpoint providing powerful AI-powered search capabilities:

**Search Strategies:**
- **hybrid** (default): Combines neural (semantic) and keyword (BM25) matching
- **neural**: Pure semantic search using embeddings
- **keyword**: Traditional keyword-based BM25 search

**Features:**
- **Query expansion**: Generate query variations to improve recall
- **Filter interpretation**: Extract structured filters from natural language
- **Reranking**: LLM-based reranking for improved relevance
- **Answer generation**: AI-generated answers based on search results

**Note**: Accepts both new SearchRequest and legacy LegacySearchRequest formats
for backwards compatibility.

parameters.name: readable_id

schema.description: The unique readable identifier of the collection to search
schema.title: Readable Id

parameters.description: The unique readable identifier of the collection to search

200.description: Search results with optional AI completion

schema.title: Response Search Collections  Readable Id  Search Post

post.description:
Create a new source connection to sync data from an external source.

The authentication method determines the creation flow:

- **Direct**: Provide credentials (API key, token) directly. Connection is created immediately.
- **OAuth Browser**: Returns a connection with an `auth_url` to redirect users for authentication.
- **OAuth Token**: Provide an existing OAuth token. Connection is created immediately.
- **Auth Provider**: Use a pre-configured auth provider (e.g., Composio, Pipedream).

After successful authentication, data sync can begin automatically or on-demand.

get.description:
Retrieve all source connections for your organization.

Returns a lightweight list of source connections with essential fields for
display and navigation. Use the collection filter to see connections within
a specific collection.

For full connection details including sync history, use the GET /{id} endpoint.

parameters.name: collection

schema.description: Filter by collection readable ID
schema.title: Collection

parameters.description: Filter by collection readable ID

parameters.name: skip

schema.description: Number of connections to skip for pagination
schema.title: Skip

parameters.description: Number of connections to skip for pagination

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Maximum number of connections to return (1-1000)
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: Maximum number of connections to return (1-1000)

get.description:
Retrieve details of a specific source connection.

Returns complete information about the connection including:
- Configuration settings
- Authentication status
- Sync schedule and history
- Entity statistics

parameters.name: source_connection_id

schema.description: Unique identifier of the source connection (UUID)
schema.title: Source Connection Id

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the source connection (UUID)

patch.description:
Update an existing source connection's configuration.

You can modify:
- **Name and description**: Display information
- **Configuration**: Source-specific settings (e.g., repository name, filters)
- **Schedule**: Cron expression for automatic syncs
- **Authentication**: Update credentials (direct auth only)

Only include the fields you want to change; omitted fields retain their current values.

parameters.name: source_connection_id

schema.description: Unique identifier of the source connection to update (UUID)
schema.title: Source Connection Id

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the source connection to update (UUID)

delete.description:
Permanently delete a source connection and all its synced data.

**What happens when you delete:**

1. Any running sync is cancelled and the API waits (up to 15 s) for the
   worker to stop writing.
2. The source connection, sync configuration, job history, and entity
   metadata are cascade-deleted from the database.
3. A background cleanup workflow is scheduled to remove data from the
   vector database (Vespa) and raw data storage (ARF). This may take
   several minutes for large datasets but does **not** block the response.

The API returns immediately after step 2. Vector database cleanup happens
asynchronously -- the data becomes unsearchable as soon as the database
records are deleted.

**Warning**: This action cannot be undone.

parameters.name: source_connection_id

schema.description: Unique identifier of the source connection to delete (UUID)
schema.title: Source Connection Id

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the source connection to delete (UUID)

post.description:
Trigger a data synchronization job for a source connection.

Starts an asynchronous sync job that pulls the latest data from the connected
source. The job runs in the background and you can monitor its progress using
the jobs endpoint.

For continuous sync connections, this performs an incremental sync by default.
Use `force_full_sync=true` to perform a complete re-sync of all data.

parameters.name: source_connection_id

schema.description: Unique identifier of the source connection to sync (UUID)
schema.title: Source Connection Id

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the source connection to sync (UUID)

parameters.name: force_full_sync

schema.description: Force a full sync ignoring cursor data. Only applies to continuous sync connections. Non-continuous connections always perform full syncs.
schema.title: Force Full Sync

parameters.description: Force a full sync ignoring cursor data. Only applies to continuous sync connections. Non-continuous connections always perform full syncs.

get.description:
Retrieve the sync job history for a source connection.

Returns a list of sync jobs ordered by creation time (newest first). Each job
includes status, timing information, and entity counts.

Job statuses:
- **PENDING**: Job is queued, waiting for the worker to pick it up
- **RUNNING**: Sync is actively pulling and processing data
- **COMPLETED**: Sync finished successfully
- **FAILED**: Sync encountered an unrecoverable error
- **CANCELLING**: Cancellation has been requested. The worker is
  gracefully stopping the pipeline and cleaning up destination data.
- **CANCELLED**: Sync was cancelled. The worker has fully stopped
  and destination data cleanup has been scheduled.

parameters.name: source_connection_id

schema.description: Unique identifier of the source connection (UUID)
schema.title: Source Connection Id

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the source connection (UUID)

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Maximum number of jobs to return (1-1000)
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: Maximum number of jobs to return (1-1000)

schema.title: Response 200 Get Source Connection Jobs Source Connections  Source Connection Id  Jobs Get

post.description:
Request cancellation of a running sync job.

**State lifecycle**: `PENDING` / `RUNNING` → `CANCELLING` → `CANCELLED`

1. The API immediately marks the job as **CANCELLING** in the database.
2. A cancellation signal is sent to the Temporal workflow.
3. The worker receives the signal, gracefully stops the sync pipeline
   (cancels worker pool, source stream), and marks the job as **CANCELLED**.

Already-processed entities are retained in the vector database.
If the worker is unresponsive, a background cleanup job will force the
transition to CANCELLED after 3 minutes.

**Note**: Only jobs in `PENDING` or `RUNNING` state can be cancelled.
Attempting to cancel a `COMPLETED`, `FAILED`, or `CANCELLED` job returns 400.

parameters.name: source_connection_id

schema.description: Unique identifier of the source connection (UUID)
schema.title: Source Connection Id

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the source connection (UUID)

parameters.name: job_id

schema.description: Unique identifier of the sync job to cancel (UUID)
schema.title: Job Id

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the sync job to cancel (UUID)

get.description:
Retrieve all webhook messages for your organization.

Webhook messages represent payloads that were sent (or attempted to be sent)
to your subscribed endpoints. Each message contains the event type, payload data,
and delivery status information.

Use the `event_types` query parameter to filter messages by specific event types,
such as `sync.completed` or `sync.failed`.

parameters.name: event_types

schema.description: Filter messages by event type(s). Accepts multiple values, e.g., `?event_types=sync.completed&event_types=sync.failed`.
schema.title: Event Types

parameters.description: Filter messages by event type(s). Accepts multiple values, e.g., `?event_types=sync.completed&event_types=sync.failed`.

schema.title: Response 200 Get Messages Webhooks Messages Get

get.description:
Retrieve a specific webhook message by its ID.

Returns the full message details including the event type, payload data,
timestamp, and delivery channel information. Use this to inspect the
exact payload that was sent to your webhook endpoints.

Use `include_attempts=true` to also retrieve delivery attempts for this message,
which include HTTP response codes, response bodies, and timestamps for debugging
delivery failures.

parameters.name: message_id

schema.description: The unique identifier of the message to retrieve (UUID).
schema.title: Message Id

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the message to retrieve (UUID).

parameters.name: include_attempts

schema.description: Include delivery attempts for this message. Each attempt includes the HTTP response code, response body, and timestamp.
schema.title: Include Attempts

parameters.description: Include delivery attempts for this message. Each attempt includes the HTTP response code, response body, and timestamp.

get.description:
List all webhook subscriptions for your organization.

Returns all configured webhook endpoints, including their URLs, subscribed
event types, and current status (enabled/disabled). Use this to audit
your webhook configuration or find a specific subscription.

schema.title: Response 200 Get Subscriptions Webhooks Subscriptions Get

post.description:
Create a new webhook subscription.

Webhook subscriptions allow you to receive real-time notifications when events
occur in Airweave. When you create a subscription, you specify:

- **URL**: The HTTPS endpoint where events will be delivered
- **Event Types**: Which events you want to receive (e.g., `sync.completed`, `sync.failed`)
- **Secret** (optional): A custom signing secret for verifying webhook signatures

After creation, Airweave will send HTTP POST requests to your URL whenever
matching events occur. Each request includes a signature header for verification.

get.description:
Retrieve a specific webhook subscription with its recent delivery attempts.

Returns the subscription configuration along with a history of message delivery
attempts. This is useful for debugging delivery issues or verifying that your
endpoint is correctly receiving events.

Use `include_secret=true` to also retrieve the signing secret for webhook
signature verification. Keep this secret secure.

parameters.name: subscription_id

schema.description: The unique identifier of the subscription to retrieve (UUID).
schema.title: Subscription Id

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the subscription to retrieve (UUID).

parameters.name: include_secret

schema.description: Include the signing secret for webhook signature verification. Keep this secret secure and use it to verify the 'svix-signature' header.
schema.title: Include Secret

parameters.description: Include the signing secret for webhook signature verification. Keep this secret secure and use it to verify the 'svix-signature' header.

delete.description:
Permanently delete a webhook subscription.

Once deleted, Airweave will stop sending events to this endpoint immediately.
This action cannot be undone. Any pending message deliveries will be cancelled.

If you want to temporarily stop receiving events, consider disabling the
subscription instead using the PATCH endpoint.

parameters.name: subscription_id

schema.description: The unique identifier of the subscription to delete (UUID).
schema.title: Subscription Id

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the subscription to delete (UUID).

patch.description:
Update an existing webhook subscription.

Use this endpoint to modify a subscription's configuration. You can:

- **Change the URL**: Update where events are delivered
- **Update event types**: Modify which events trigger notifications
- **Enable/disable**: Temporarily pause delivery without deleting the subscription
- **Recover messages**: When re-enabling, optionally recover missed messages

Only include the fields you want to change. Omitted fields will retain their
current values.

When re-enabling a subscription (`disabled: false`), you can optionally provide
`recover_since` to automatically retry all messages that were generated while
the subscription was disabled.

parameters.name: subscription_id

schema.description: The unique identifier of the subscription to update (UUID).
schema.title: Subscription Id

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the subscription to update (UUID).

post.description:
Retry failed message deliveries for a webhook subscription.

Triggers a recovery process that replays all failed messages within the
specified time window. This is useful when:

- Your endpoint was temporarily down and you want to catch up
- You've fixed a bug in your webhook handler
- You want to reprocess events after re-enabling a disabled subscription

Messages are retried in chronological order. Successfully delivered messages
are skipped; only failed or pending messages are retried.

parameters.name: subscription_id

schema.description: The unique identifier of the subscription to recover messages for (UUID).
schema.title: Subscription Id

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the subscription to recover messages for (UUID).

auth_fields.description: Dynamically populated field definitions for authentication configuration. These describe what credentials are required to connect to this auth provider.

config_fields.description: Dynamically populated field definitions for auth provider-specific configuration. These describe what additional configuration is required when using this auth provider to connect to a source (e.g., auth_config_id and account_id for Composio).

CheckoutSessionRequest.title: CheckoutSessionRequest

name.title: Name
name.description: Human-readable display name for the collection.

readable_id.title: Readable Id
readable_id.description: URL-safe unique identifier used in API endpoints. This becomes non-optional once the collection is created.

id.title: Id
id.description: Unique system identifier for the collection. This UUID is generated automatically and used for internal references.

vector_size.title: Vector Size
vector_size.description: Vector dimensions used by this collection. Determines which embedding model is used: 3072 (text-embedding-3-large), 1536 (text-embedding-3-small), 1024 (mistral-embed), or 384 (MiniLM-L6-v2).

embedding_model_name.title: Embedding Model Name
embedding_model_name.description: Name of the embedding model used for this collection (e.g., 'text-embedding-3-large', 'text-embedding-3-small', 'mistral-embed'). This ensures queries use the same model as the indexed data.

sync_config.description: Default sync configuration for all syncs in this collection. Overridable at sync and job level.

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description: Timestamp when the collection was created (ISO 8601 format).

modified_at.title: Modified At
modified_at.description: Timestamp when the collection was last modified (ISO 8601 format).

organization_id.title: Organization Id
organization_id.description: Identifier of the organization that owns this collection. Collections are isolated per organization.

created_by_email.title: Created By Email
created_by_email.description: Email address of the user who created this collection.

modified_by_email.title: Modified By Email
modified_by_email.description: Email address of the user who last modified this collection.

status.description:
Current operational status of the collection:
• **NEEDS_SOURCE**: Collection has no authenticated connections, or connections exist but haven't synced yet
• **ACTIVE**: At least one connection has completed a sync or is currently syncing
• **ERROR**: All connections have failed their last sync

Collection.title: Collection
Collection.description:
Complete collection representation returned by the API.

This schema includes all collection metadata plus computed status information
based on the health and state of associated source connections.

name.title: Name
name.description: Human-readable display name for the collection. This appears in the UI and should clearly describe the data contained within (e.g., 'Finance Data').

readable_id.title: Readable Id
readable_id.description: URL-safe unique identifier used in API endpoints. Must contain only lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens. If not provided, it will be automatically generated from the collection name with a random suffix for uniqueness (e.g., 'finance-data-ab123').

sync_config.description: Default sync configuration for all syncs in this collection. This provides collection-level defaults that can be overridden at sync or job level.

CollectionCreate.title: CollectionCreate
CollectionCreate.description:
Schema for creating a new collection.

Collections serve as logical containers for organizing related data sources.
Once created, you can add source connections to populate the collection with data
from various sources like databases, APIs, and file systems.

You can optionally set a default sync configuration that will apply to all syncs
within this collection unless overridden at the sync or job level.

name.title: Name
name.description: Updated display name for the collection. Must be between 4 and 64 characters.

sync_config.description: Default sync configuration for all syncs in this collection. This provides collection-level defaults that can be overridden at sync or job level.

CollectionUpdate.title: CollectionUpdate
CollectionUpdate.description:
Schema for updating an existing collection.

Allows updating the collection's display name and default sync configuration.
The readable_id is immutable to maintain stable API endpoints and references.

ConfigValues.title: ConfigValues
ConfigValues.description:
Config values model.

Implements "flat dictionary" semantics, where no values are dictionaries.

detail.title: Detail
detail.example: A resource with this identifier already exists

ConflictErrorResponse.title: ConflictErrorResponse
ConflictErrorResponse.description:
Response returned when a resource conflict occurs (HTTP 409).

This typically occurs when attempting to create a resource that already exists,
or when an operation cannot be completed due to the current state of a resource.

example.detail: A resource with this identifier already exists

name.title: Name
name.description: Human-readable display name for the connection.

readable_id.title: Readable Id
readable_id.description: URL-safe unique identifier used in API endpoints. This becomes non-optional once the connection is created.

id.title: Id
id.description: Unique system identifier for the connection.

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description: Timestamp when the connection was created (ISO 8601 format).

modified_at.title: Modified At
modified_at.description: Timestamp when the connection was last modified (ISO 8601 format).

Connection.title: Connection
Connection.description: Schema for connection with config fields.

url.title: Url
url.description: The HTTPS URL where webhook events will be delivered. Must be a publicly accessible endpoint that returns a 2xx status code.

event_types.title: Event Types
event_types.description: List of event types to subscribe to. Events not in this list will not be delivered to this subscription. Available types: `sync.pending`, `sync.running`, `sync.completed`, `sync.failed`, `sync.cancelled`, `source_connection.created`, `source_connection.auth_completed`, `source_connection.deleted`, `collection.created`, `collection.updated`, `collection.deleted`.

secret.title: Secret
secret.description: Optional custom signing secret for webhook signature verification. If not provided, a secure secret will be auto-generated. Must be at least 24 characters if specified.

CreateSubscriptionRequest.title: CreateSubscriptionRequest
CreateSubscriptionRequest.description:
Create a new webhook subscription.

Webhook subscriptions define where Airweave should send event notifications.
You can subscribe to specific event types to receive only the events you care about.

return_url.title: Return Url
return_url.description: URL to return to after portal session

CustomerPortalRequest.title: CustomerPortalRequest
CustomerPortalRequest.description: Request to create customer portal session.

id.title: Id
id.description: Unique identifier for this delivery attempt

message_id.title: Message Id
message_id.description: The event message that was being delivered

endpoint_id.title: Endpoint Id
endpoint_id.description: The subscription endpoint this was delivered to

response.title: Response
response.description: The response body returned by your webhook endpoint (truncated to 1KB)

response_status_code.title: Response Status Code
response_status_code.description: HTTP status code returned by your webhook endpoint. 2xx codes indicate success; other codes trigger retries.

status.title: Status
status.description: Delivery status: `success` (2xx response), `pending` (awaiting delivery), or `failed` (non-2xx response or timeout)

timestamp.title: Timestamp
timestamp.description: When this delivery attempt occurred (ISO 8601 format, UTC)

DeliveryAttempt.title: DeliveryAttempt
DeliveryAttempt.description:
A delivery attempt for a webhook message.

Each time Airweave attempts to deliver a message to your webhook endpoint,
a delivery attempt is recorded. Failed attempts are automatically retried
with exponential backoff.

target_destinations.title: Target Destinations
target_destinations.description: If set, ONLY write to these destination UUIDs

DestinationWithAuthenticationFields.title: DestinationWithAuthenticationFields
DestinationWithAuthenticationFields.description: Schema for Destination with auth config.

DirectAuthentication.title: DirectAuthentication
DirectAuthentication.description: Direct authentication with API keys or passwords.

EmbeddingModelWithAuthenticationFields.title: EmbeddingModelWithAuthenticationFields
EmbeddingModelWithAuthenticationFields.description: Schema for EmbeddingModel with auth config.

EntityCountWithDefinition.title: EntityCountWithDefinition
EntityCountWithDefinition.description: Entity count with entity definition details.

EntityDefinitionCreate.title: EntityDefinitionCreate
EntityDefinitionCreate.description: Schema for creating an entity definition.

EntityTypeStats.title: EntityTypeStats
EntityTypeStats.description: Statistics for a specific entity type.

EventType.title: EventType
EventType.description:
Webhook event types.

All available event types that webhook subscribers can filter on.
Convention: {domain}.{action} — matches the event_type string
on the corresponding domain event class.

FeatureFlag.title: FeatureFlag
FeatureFlag.description:
Available feature flags in Airweave.

Add new flags here to enable feature gating at the organization level.

HandlerConfig.title: HandlerConfig
HandlerConfig.description: Controls which handlers run during sync.

IntegrationCredentialInDB.title: IntegrationCredentialInDB
IntegrationCredentialInDB.description: Integration credential in DB without decrypted data.

IntegrationCredentialRawCreate.title: IntegrationCredentialRawCreate
IntegrationCredentialRawCreate.description:
Create class for integration credentials with raw auth fields.

This schema is used when auth fields need to be validated and encrypted
before creating the credential.

score_threshold.title: Score Threshold
score_threshold.description: Minimum similarity score threshold (deprecated, will be ignored)

recency_bias.title: Recency Bias
recency_bias.description: How much document age affects the similarity score (0..1)

enable_reranking.title: Enable Reranking
enable_reranking.description: Enable LLM-based reranking to improve result relevance

enable_query_interpretation.title: Enable Query Interpretation
enable_query_interpretation.description: Enable automatic filter extraction from natural language query

LegacySearchRequest.title: LegacySearchRequest
LegacySearchRequest.description: Legacy search request schema for backwards compatibility.

response_type.description: Indicates whether results are raw search matches or AI-generated completions

completion.title: Completion
completion.description: AI-generated natural language answer when response_type is 'completion'

LegacySearchResponse.title: LegacySearchResponse
LegacySearchResponse.description: Legacy search response schema for backwards compatibility.

cron_expression.title: Cron Expression
cron_expression.description: Minute-level cron expression for incremental sync (default: every minute)

MinuteLevelScheduleConfig.title: MinuteLevelScheduleConfig
MinuteLevelScheduleConfig.description: Configuration for minute-level incremental sync schedules.

detail.title: Detail
detail.description: Error message describing what was not found

NotFoundErrorResponse.title: NotFoundErrorResponse
NotFoundErrorResponse.description: Response returned when a resource is not found (HTTP 404).

OAuthBrowserAuthentication.title: OAuthBrowserAuthentication
OAuthBrowserAuthentication.description:
OAuth authentication via browser flow.

Supports both OAuth2 and OAuth1 BYOC (Bring Your Own Client):
- OAuth2 BYOC: Provide client_id + client_secret
- OAuth1 BYOC: Provide consumer_key + consumer_secret

enabled_features.title: Enabled Features
enabled_features.description: List of enabled feature flags for this organization

billing.description: Complete billing information including current period

Organization.title: Organization
Organization.description:
Organization schema with billing and feature information.

This is the primary organization schema used in API contexts, enriched with
billing (including current period) and feature flags for efficient access
without additional database queries.

Access billing info compositionally:
- organization.billing.plan
- organization.billing.status
- organization.billing.current_period

OrganizationBilling.title: OrganizationBilling
OrganizationBilling.description:
Organization billing schema with current period information.

This schema is enriched with the current active billing period for
efficient access to rate limits and billing status without additional queries.

billing_plan.title: Billing Plan
billing_plan.description: Current billing plan (trial, starter, pro, enterprise)

source_connection_count.title: Source Connection Count
source_connection_count.description: Number of source connections (computed from source_connection table)

last_active_at.title: Last Active At
last_active_at.description: Last active timestamp of any user in this organization

is_member.title: Is Member
is_member.description: Whether the current admin user is already a member

member_role.title: Member Role
member_role.description: Admin's role in this organization (if member)

enabled_features.title: Enabled Features
enabled_features.description: List of enabled feature flags for this organization

OrganizationMetrics.title: OrganizationMetrics
OrganizationMetrics.description:
Comprehensive organization metrics for admin dashboard.

Combines organization info with billing and usage metrics from the Usage model.

enabled_features.title: Enabled Features
enabled_features.description: List of enabled feature flags for this organization

billing.description: Complete billing information including current period

OrganizationWithRole.title: OrganizationWithRole
OrganizationWithRole.description: Organization schema with user's role information.

url.title: Url
url.description: New URL for webhook delivery. Must be a publicly accessible HTTPS endpoint.

event_types.title: Event Types
event_types.description: New list of event types to subscribe to. This replaces the existing list entirely.

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description: Set to `true` to pause delivery to this subscription, or `false` to resume. Disabled subscriptions will not receive events.

recover_since.title: Recover Since
recover_since.description: When re-enabling a subscription (`disabled: false`), optionally recover failed messages from this timestamp. Only applies when enabling.

PatchSubscriptionRequest.title: PatchSubscriptionRequest
PatchSubscriptionRequest.description:
Update an existing webhook subscription.

All fields are optional. Only provided fields will be updated;
omitted fields retain their current values.

When re-enabling a subscription (setting `disabled: false`), you can optionally
provide `recover_since` to replay messages that were missed while disabled.

detail.title: Detail
detail.description: Error message explaining the rate limit
detail.example: Rate limit exceeded. Please retry after 60 seconds.

RateLimitErrorResponse.title: RateLimitErrorResponse
RateLimitErrorResponse.description:
Response returned when rate limit is exceeded (HTTP 429).

The API enforces rate limits to ensure fair usage. When exceeded,
wait for the duration specified in the Retry-After header before retrying.

example.detail: Rate limit exceeded. Please retry after 60 seconds.

since.title: Since
since.description: Start of the recovery time window (inclusive). All failed messages from this time onward will be retried.

until.title: Until
until.description: End of the recovery time window (exclusive). If not specified, recovers all failed messages up to now.

RecoverMessagesRequest.title: RecoverMessagesRequest
RecoverMessagesRequest.description:
Request to retry failed message deliveries.

Use this to replay events that failed to deliver during a specific time window,
for example after fixing an issue with your webhook endpoint.

id.title: Id
id.description: Unique identifier for this recovery task (Svix internal ID)

RecoveryTask.title: RecoveryTask
RecoveryTask.description:
Information about a message recovery task.

When you trigger a recovery of failed messages, this object is returned
to track the recovery progress. The status indicates whether the recovery
is still in progress or has completed.

ResponseType.title: ResponseType
ResponseType.description: Response format options for search results.

external_id.title: External Id
external_id.description: External ID for secure cross-account trust policy

S3ConfigRequest.title: S3ConfigRequest
S3ConfigRequest.description: Request to configure S3 destination with IAM role.

query.title: Query
query.description: The search query text (required, max 2048 tokens)
query.example: How do I reset my password?

filter.title: Filter
filter.description: Structured filter for metadata-based filtering (Qdrant filter format)

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: Number of results to skip for pagination (default: 0)

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: Maximum number of results to return (default: 1000)

temporal_relevance.title: Temporal Relevance
temporal_relevance.description: DEPRECATED: This field is accepted for backwards compatibility but ignored. Temporal relevance has been removed.

expand_query.title: Expand Query
expand_query.description: Generate query variations to improve recall (default: true)

interpret_filters.title: Interpret Filters
interpret_filters.description: Extract structured filters from natural language (e.g., 'from last week' becomes a date filter)

rerank.title: Rerank
rerank.description: LLM-based reranking for improved relevance (default: true)

generate_answer.title: Generate Answer
generate_answer.description: Generate an AI answer based on search results (default: true)

SearchRequest.title: SearchRequest
SearchRequest.description:
Search request for querying a collection.

Provides fine-grained control over the search pipeline including retrieval strategy,
filtering, and AI-powered features like query expansion and answer generation.

value.query: How do I reset my password?
What are best practices for error handling?

results.title: Results
results.description: Array of search result objects containing the found documents, records, or data entities. Each result includes entity_id, source_name, md_content, metadata, score, breadcrumbs, and url.

completion.title: Completion
completion.description: AI-generated natural language answer to your query based on the search results. Only included when generate_answer is true in the request.

SearchResponse.title: SearchResponse
SearchResponse.description:
Search response containing results and optional AI-generated completion.

Each result includes the matched entity's content, metadata, relevance score,
and source information.

example.completion: To reset your password, navigate to the login page and click 'Forgot Password'. You'll receive an email with a reset link that expires in 24 hours. For security, ensure you're using a strong password with at least 12 characters.

results.md_content:
# Password Reset Guide

To reset your password...

## User Authentication

Password reset is available...

SearchStatus.title: SearchStatus
SearchStatus.description: Status indicators for search operation outcomes.

allowed.title: Allowed
allowed.description: Whether the action is allowed for the organization

action.title: Action
action.description: The action type that was checked

reason.title: Reason
reason.description: Reason why the action is not allowed (if applicable)

details.title: Details
details.description: Additional details about why the action is not allowed

SingleActionCheckResponse.title: SingleActionCheckResponse
SingleActionCheckResponse.description: Response schema for single action permission check.

name.title: Name
name.description: Human-readable name of the data source connector (e.g., 'GitHub', 'Stripe', 'PostgreSQL').

description.title: Description
description.description: Detailed description explaining what data this source can extract and its typical use cases.

oauth_type.title: Oauth Type
oauth_type.description: OAuth token type for OAuth sources (e.g., 'access_only', 'with_refresh').

requires_byoc.title: Requires Byoc
requires_byoc.description: Whether this OAuth source requires users to bring their own client.

auth_config_class.title: Auth Config Class
auth_config_class.description: Python class name that defines the authentication configuration fields required for this source (only for DIRECT auth).

config_class.title: Config Class
config_class.description: Python class name that defines the source-specific configuration options and parameters.

short_name.title: Short Name
short_name.description: Technical identifier used internally to reference this source type. Must be unique across all sources.

class_name.title: Class Name
class_name.description: Python class name of the source implementation that handles data extraction logic.

output_entity_definitions.title: Output Entity Definitions
output_entity_definitions.description: List of entity definition short names that this source can produce (e.g., ['asana_task_entity', 'asana_project_entity']).

labels.title: Labels
labels.description: Categorization tags to help users discover and filter sources by domain or use case.

supports_continuous.title: Supports Continuous
supports_continuous.description: Whether this source supports cursor-based continuous syncing for incremental data extraction. Sources with this capability can track their sync position and resume from where they left off.

federated_search.title: Federated Search
federated_search.description: Whether this source uses federated search instead of traditional syncing. Federated search sources query data in real-time during searches rather than syncing and indexing all data beforehand.

supports_temporal_relevance.title: Supports Temporal Relevance
supports_temporal_relevance.description: Whether this source's entities have timestamps that enable recency-based ranking. Sources without file-level timestamps (e.g., code repositories) cannot use temporal relevance for search result weighting.

supports_access_control.title: Supports Access Control
supports_access_control.description: Whether this source supports document-level access control. Sources with this capability extract ACL information from the source and apply it during search to filter results based on user permissions.

rate_limit_level.title: Rate Limit Level
rate_limit_level.description: Rate limiting level for this source: 'org' (organization-wide), 'connection' (per-connection/per-user), or None (no rate limiting).

feature_flag.title: Feature Flag
feature_flag.description: Feature flag required to access this source. If set, only organizations with this feature enabled can see/use this source.

auth_fields.description: Schema definition for authentication fields required to connect to this source. Only present for sources using DIRECT authentication. OAuth sources handle authentication through browser flows.

config_fields.description: Schema definition for configuration fields required to customize this source. Describes field types, validation rules, and user interface hints.

supported_auth_providers.title: Supported Auth Providers
supported_auth_providers.description: List of auth provider short names that support this source (e.g., ['composio', 'pipedream']). Computed dynamically for API responses. This field is not stored in the database.

Source.title: Source
Source.description:
Complete source representation with authentication and configuration schemas.

Served from the in-memory SourceRegistry — no database row needed.

fields.description: Personal Access Token with repository read permissions. Generate one at https://github.com/settings/tokens
fields.name: personal_access_token
fields.title: Personal Access Token

fields.description: Specific branch to sync (e.g., 'main', 'development'). If empty, uses the default branch.
fields.name: branch
fields.title: Branch name

examples.description: Connect to GitHub repositories for code, issues, pull requests, and documentation
examples.name: GitHub

examples.description: Connect to Gmail for email threads, messages, and attachments
examples.name: Gmail

id.title: Id
id.description: Unique identifier of the source connection

description.title: Description
description.description: Optional description of the connection's purpose

status.description: Current operational status of the connection

modified_at.title: Modified At
modified_at.description: When the connection was last modified (ISO 8601)

sync_id.title: Sync Id
sync_id.description: ID of the associated sync (internal use)

entities.description: Summary of synced entities by type

federated_search.title: Federated Search
federated_search.description: Whether this source uses federated (real-time) search instead of syncing

SourceConnection.title: SourceConnection
SourceConnection.description:
Complete source connection details including auth, config, sync status, and entities.

This schema provides full information about a source connection, suitable for
detail views and monitoring sync progress.

name.title: Name
name.description: Display name for the connection. If not provided, defaults to '{Source Name} Connection'.

readable_collection_id.title: Readable Collection Id
readable_collection_id.description: The readable ID of the collection to add this connection to

description.title: Description
description.description: Optional description of what this connection is used for

sync_immediately.title: Sync Immediately
sync_immediately.description: Run initial sync after creation. Defaults to True for direct/token/auth_provider, False for OAuth browser/BYOC flows (which sync after authentication)

authentication.title: Authentication
authentication.description: Authentication configuration. Type is auto-detected from provided fields.

redirect_url.title: Redirect Url
redirect_url.description: URL to redirect to after OAuth flow completes (only used for OAuth flows)

SourceConnectionCreate.title: SourceConnectionCreate
SourceConnectionCreate.description:
Create a source connection with authentication configuration.

Source connections link a data source (e.g., GitHub, Slack) to a collection.
The authentication method determines how credentials are provided and whether
the connection is created immediately or requires an OAuth flow.

id.title: Id
id.description: Unique identifier of the sync job

source_connection_id.title: Source Connection Id
source_connection_id.description: ID of the source connection this job belongs to

status.description: Current status: PENDING, RUNNING, COMPLETED, FAILED, CANCELLED, or CANCELLING

completed_at.title: Completed At
completed_at.description: When the job finished (ISO 8601). Null if still running.

duration_seconds.title: Duration Seconds
duration_seconds.description: Total execution time in seconds. Null if still running.

entities_inserted.title: Entities Inserted
entities_inserted.description: Number of new entities created during this sync

entities_updated.title: Entities Updated
entities_updated.description: Number of existing entities updated during this sync

entities_deleted.title: Entities Deleted
entities_deleted.description: Number of entities removed during this sync

entities_failed.title: Entities Failed
entities_failed.description: Number of entities that failed to process

error.title: Error
error.description: Error message if the job failed

SourceConnectionJob.title: SourceConnectionJob
SourceConnectionJob.description:
A sync job representing a single synchronization run.

Sync jobs track the execution of data synchronization from a source connection.
Each job includes timing information, entity counts, and error details if applicable.

id.title: Id
id.description: Unique identifier of the source connection

modified_at.title: Modified At
modified_at.description: When the connection was last modified (ISO 8601)

is_authenticated.title: Is Authenticated
is_authenticated.description: Whether the connection has valid credentials

entity_count.title: Entity Count
entity_count.description: Total number of entities synced from this connection

federated_search.title: Federated Search
federated_search.description: Whether this source uses federated (real-time) search instead of syncing

auth_method.description: Get authentication method from database value.

status.description: Compute connection status from current state.

SourceConnectionListItem.title: SourceConnectionListItem
SourceConnectionListItem.description:
Lightweight source connection representation for list views.

Contains essential fields for display and navigation. For full details
including sync history and configuration, use the GET /{id} endpoint.

SourceConnectionStatus.title: SourceConnectionStatus
SourceConnectionStatus.description: Source connection status enum - represents overall connection state.

name.title: Name
name.description: Updated display name for the connection

SourceConnectionUpdate.title: SourceConnectionUpdate

window_seconds.title: Window Seconds
window_seconds.description: Time window in seconds (60=per minute, 86400=per day, etc.)

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: Configured limit, None if not set

window_seconds.title: Window Seconds
window_seconds.description: Configured window, None if not set

id.title: Id
id.description: DB record ID, None if not configured

SourceRateLimitResponse.title: SourceRateLimitResponse
SourceRateLimitResponse.description: Response schema with source metadata merged for UI display.

SourceRateLimitUpdateRequest.title: SourceRateLimitUpdateRequest
SourceRateLimitUpdateRequest.description: Request schema for updating rate limits via API.

cancel_at_period_end.title: Cancel At Period End
cancel_at_period_end.description: Whether subscription will cancel at period end

requires_payment_method.title: Requires Payment Method
requires_payment_method.description: Whether payment method is required now

pending_plan_change.title: Pending Plan Change
pending_plan_change.description: Plan that will take effect at period end

pending_plan_change_at.title: Pending Plan Change At
pending_plan_change_at.description: When the pending plan change takes effect

has_yearly_prepay.title: Has Yearly Prepay
has_yearly_prepay.description: Whether organization has an active yearly prepay credit

yearly_prepay_amount_cents.title: Yearly Prepay Amount Cents
yearly_prepay_amount_cents.description: Total amount (in cents) credited for yearly prepay

yearly_prepay_coupon_id.title: Yearly Prepay Coupon Id
yearly_prepay_coupon_id.description: Coupon ID used for yearly prepay

yearly_prepay_payment_intent_id.title: Yearly Prepay Payment Intent Id
yearly_prepay_payment_intent_id.description: Payment intent ID used for yearly prepay

SyncConfig.title: SyncConfig
SyncConfig.description:
Sync configuration with automatic env var loading.

Env vars use double underscore as delimiter:
    SYNC_CONFIG__HANDLERS__ENABLE_VECTOR_HANDLERS=false

SyncCreate.title: SyncCreate
SyncCreate.description: Schema for creating a Sync object.

sync_name.title: Sync Name
sync_name.description: Name of the sync, populated from join query

SyncUpdate.title: SyncUpdate
SyncUpdate.description: Schema for updating a Sync object.

period.title: Period
period.description: Billing period for the plan: 'monthly' or 'yearly'

trends.title: Trends
trends.description: Usage trends compared to previous period

direction.title: Direction
direction.description: Trend direction: up, down, or stable

UserCreate.title: UserCreate
UserCreate.description: Schema for creating a User object.

UserOrganization.title: UserOrganization
UserOrganization.description: Schema for UserOrganization relationship with full organization details.

ValidationErrorDetail.title: ValidationErrorDetail
ValidationErrorDetail.description: Details about a validation error for a specific field.

ValidationErrorResponse.title: ValidationErrorResponse
ValidationErrorResponse.description:
Response returned when request validation fails (HTTP 422).

This occurs when the request body contains invalid data, such as
malformed URLs, invalid event types, or missing required fields.

detail.msg: Invalid URL: scheme must be http or https

id.title: Id
id.description: Unique identifier for this message (UUID format)

payload.title: Payload
payload.description: The event payload data, matching what is delivered to webhooks. Structure varies by event_type.

timestamp.title: Timestamp
timestamp.description: When this message was created (ISO 8601 format, UTC)

channels.title: Channels
channels.description: Channels this message was sent to (typically matches the event type)

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: Tags associated with this message for filtering

WebhookMessage.title: WebhookMessage
WebhookMessage.description:
A webhook message that was sent (or attempted) to webhook subscribers.

The payload contains the actual event data matching the webhook delivery format.

id.title: Id
id.description: Unique identifier for this message (UUID format)

payload.title: Payload
payload.description: The event payload data, matching what is delivered to webhooks. Structure varies by event_type.

timestamp.title: Timestamp
timestamp.description: When this message was created (ISO 8601 format, UTC)

channels.title: Channels
channels.description: Channels this message was sent to (typically matches the event type)

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: Tags associated with this message for filtering

WebhookMessageWithAttempts.title: WebhookMessageWithAttempts
WebhookMessageWithAttempts.description: A webhook message with delivery attempts.

id.title: Id
id.description: Unique identifier for this subscription (UUID format)

url.title: Url
url.description: The URL where webhook events are delivered

filter_types.title: Filter Types
filter_types.description: Event types this subscription is filtered to receive. See EventType enum for all available types.

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.description: Whether this subscription is currently disabled. Disabled subscriptions do not receive event deliveries.

description.title: Description
description.description: Optional human-readable description of this subscription

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description: When this subscription was created (ISO 8601 format, UTC)

updated_at.title: Updated At
updated_at.description: When this subscription was last updated (ISO 8601 format, UTC)

delivery_attempts.title: Delivery Attempts
delivery_attempts.description: Recent delivery attempts for this subscription. Only included when fetching a single subscription via GET /subscriptions/{id}.

secret.title: Secret
secret.description: The signing secret for webhook signature verification. Only included when include_secret=true is passed to the API. Keep this secret secure.

tags.name: collections
tags.description: API endpoints for managing collections - logical groups of data sources that provide unified search capabilities

tags.name: source-connections
tags.description: API endpoints for managing live connections to data sources. Source connections are the actual configured instances that Airweave uses to sync data from your apps and databases, transforming it into searchable, structured information within collections

tags.name: sources
tags.description: API endpoints for discovering available data source connectors and their configuration requirements

tags.name: webhooks
tags.description: API endpoints for managing webhook subscriptions and messages. Subscribe to events like sync completions to receive real-time notifications at your webhook URL
